page.title: 01NATURAL FEATURES
page.content: The name{Glenravel}derives from an area drained by the R.Ravel bounded on three sides by mountains to a height of 1,600 feet and opening in the south to fat farming land leading to Ballymena, the market town eight miles away . The land formerly{moss and bog}has been reclaimed especially during the years of the last war and more recently encouraged by generous grants provided for less favoured areas. This marginal land in the foot hills is{rough {pasture and pasture}adequate for {sheep and cattle}the livelihood of the people. The principal feature is the busy main road carrying heavy freight lorries workers cars and tourist coaches between city and country and seaside. {Three rivers}which are {hardly more than swift flowing {streams}flow into lough Neagh.2
